title: cheezcarls
author: cheezcarls
content: Source: https://twitter.com/MixinKernel/status/1706139175018529139Oh my freaking goodness! These hackers are working tirelessly to steal approximately $200M in the Mixin Network. Correct me if I'm wrong, but this could be the biggest crypto hack for this year right? Or for the entirety already?Man they're getting better and intelligent right now just to bypass these tight security measures of any platform like the Mixin Network. Any thoughts of this one guys? Thanks in advance.

comments.author: $crypto$
comments.body: Just saw the thread here:  Mixin Network hacked - $200 Million lostNot only the mixin network was hit by hackers but the Huobi exchange was also hacked with 5000 ETH with a total loss of $8 million this has been confirmed by Justin Sun.But the biggest thing is that the mixin network with $200 million has involved Google and SlowMist in handling this case, they have also suspended deposits and withdrawals until now.The point is very sad that hacker attacks are now blind or is their system still weak?Still, it's a hassle.

comments.author: Ever-young
comments.body: This is crazy, I just happen to read the news right now and it’s really touching, how was this even possible, taught this was suppose to be some kind of safe, if a safe can be hacked and customers fund moved like this which means the said safe is not entirely safe, customers should just be in control of their own asset security as don’t hand it over to anyone else, this is really big and I never expected such to happen to a safe. Let’s hope something good comes out of it as the team behind it are planing on addressing affected customers, made a means for refunding will be possible or they can sort things out.

comments.author: wheelz1200
comments.body: I think what's even more crazy is the amount of money flowing through so.e of these networks or exchanges that are this consistently hacked.  I haven't read into it but why don't people just keep their money locked up where it can't get hacked.  Doesn't make sense since there are plenty of offline options.
